resources.string: Are you sure? This cannot be undone.
HyperCampus uses a spaced repetition algorithm to determine when to show a card the next time based on your grading. For more information on how and why it works, visit the project github page.
Welcome to the HyperCampus app! Use it to learn whatever you want. Would you like an introduction?
A flashcard deck is called a \"course\". Tap here to add a new course
Once you have added flashcards to your course, I manage which cards you should review each day. Tap here to review a single course â€¦
â€¦ or use the HyperCampus button to review due cards from all courses
Tap on a course to open it
Each course consists of lessons, which can be added and reviewed just like courses. Tap on a lesson to see all of its flashcards
Each card has a question â€¦
â€¦ and an answer. Add new cards with the add button or tap on an existing card to edit it
Now use the HyperCampus button to check out how reviewing your cards works
During your (hopefully) daily review, I will present some questions from your collection
Try to find the answer, and tap this button
I will reveal the answer, and you have to judge how well you knew it
Tap in the yellow region if it was easy for you, or in the violet region if you didn\'t know it at all. Or somewhere in between if, well, it was something in between. That\'s all!
